boardgame.name: Frontier Explorer (Issue 31 - Winter 2021)
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Welcome to issue 31 of the Frontier Explorer! This issue introduces a new author, Michal Lausier, who provides us a Traveller short story, Bones and Mortar. Oscar Rios provides us with ten standard sathar NPCs you can drop into your campaign. We also have another needler article following the one last issue, this time, converted to the “Alternate Frontier” setting that Richard Farris is developing.

Tom Verreault gives us four articles, a new archetype, a look at the setting details to be gleaned from the Endless Quest book “Captive Planet,” a kit-bashed dralasite miniature, and new weapon. Joseph Cabadas continues his Things that go Boom! series, this time looking at artillery, and also revisits the old Dragon article “Jetboots Don’t Fail Me Now” looking at an alternate movement system.

We round out the article with the Jurak Hangna article “Osaka Soul Plant” by Eric Winsor and the comics by Scott Mulder.

boardgame.name: Frontier Explorer (Issue 30 - Fall 2020)
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Welcome to issue 30 of the Frontier Explorer! This issue introduces two new authors RJ McDonough and Oscar Rios. RJ talks about the “Art of the Crossover” and bringing outside resources into your game while Oscar gives us a couple of new equipment articles, one on needler weapons and a second on restraints.

This issue brings back our “Frontier in Miniature” series looking at miniatures for use in your game. This time, Tom Verreault kit-bashes some computers and transmitter arrays as terrain pieces. We already have a couple more miniature articles in the queue so you can expect to see more of these in the future. We are also continuing the “An Alternate Frontier” series by Richard Farris with a look at gyrojet weapons.

I thought we would be wrapping up the “Things That Go Boom!” series by Joseph Cabadas in this issue but while I was doing the editing, he submitted another that you can look for in the next issue.

Rounding out the issue we have a pair of spaceship articles by Richard “Shadow Shack” Rose, a short adventure, some new species, and a look at food trucks in the Frontier by Tom Verreault, and a look at handling random creature encounters and an article on protective gear by Joseph Cabadas. Finally, we have our regular Jurak Hangna article by Eric Winsor and the comics by Scott Mulder.

boardgame.name: BeaR-PiGS Basic Role-Playing Game System
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

BeaR-PiGS Basic Role-Playing Game System is an easy to learn RPG inspired by Old School games with some modern mechanics thrown in.

There are: (3) Classes, (3) Ability Scores ranging from 0 to +3, (3) Saving Throws.

All mechanics following an ascending d20 mechanic.

BRPGS utilizes a word free character sheet relying only on symbols. These symbols are repeated throughout the rulebook and form easy formulas to demonstrate mechanics.
The symbols make for easy play for new players, non-English speakers, and seniors.

boardgame.name: The Starving Wings & Other Horror Stories
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

At the end of each month, discover the "Monsters of the MONTH", containing all the scenario from the past months, but implemented and augmented, exclusive hand-outs and a special scenario!

All the scenario included are quick to read and easy to add to your play nights, whether to complete an ongoing campaign, to start one or simply for a one-shot!

They are not written for a specific system or universe in order to let you modify and develop them at will.
boardgame.rpgitemversion: Les Ailes Affamées, et Autres Histoires d'Horreurs PDF
The Starving Wings & Other Horror Stories PDF

boardgame.name: Buggane
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Bugganes are humanoid creatures that can change size from roughly 8ft tall to roughly 6 inches in height. Bugganes are covered in black hair, have claws, and a large red mouth with tusks. Bugganes are the enemies of fairies and are sometimes used by the fairy lords to chase humans out of their forests. Bugganes are unable to cross water or stand on hollowed ground.

boardgame.name: Initiative Deck: Countdown From 10 - Steam Powered
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

In this box, you will find a poker deck of 52 cards, plus 2 jokers, specifically designed for tracking initiative in any roleplaying game, although it works especially well with the Savage Worlds system.

Unlike a standard deck of cards, this deck is themed to lend atmosphere to your roleplaying game. The numerical value of the card (from 0 to 10), used for Initiative, is featured prominently. Ties between cards of the same value are resolved by comparing “speed” (which goes from 1 to 5).

boardgame.name: Initiative Deck: Countdown From 10 - Super Sentai
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

In this box, you will find a poker deck of 52 cards, plus 2 jokers, specifically designed for tracking initiative in any roleplaying game, although it works especially well with the Savage Worlds system.

Unlike a standard deck of cards, this deck is themed to lend atmosphere to your roleplaying game. The numerical value of the card (from 0 to 10), used for Initiative, is featured prominently. Ties between cards of the same value are resolved by comparing “speed” (which goes from 1 to 5).

The classic playing card values and suits are still shown, for reference, but are relegated to a small section of the card.

This theme adds a sixth color (purple) used exclusively on the two rank 0 cards to further differentiate them from the rest.

The classic playing card values and suits are still shown, for reference, but are relegated to a small section of the card.

boardgame.name: Deck of Evil Objects
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Use this deck when you, the GM, wish to add a random object of evil to the campaign. These are suitable as treasure items, though they may throw off the balance of your campaign a bit. No problem, just have a monster destroy or steal the object.

boardgame.name: The Exiled Sanguinary
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Beneath and within the nobility of this world exists a second, secret aristocracy.

You once held court in the gutters, sewers and tombs where fawning courtiers paid you tribute in blood and death and fear…

...Then you blew it

Now you have to work for your blood, fight for your life and deign to tolerate these lowborn ruffians who refuse to use your proper honorifics.

boardgame.name: Dragons Wild
boardgame.description:
A fast playing card game based on Rummy, with a deck of 1-8 number cards in 8 suits, each a different mythical creature, plus 6 wild Dragon cards. Play a set or run of cards (meld) or play onto another meld. Score points for the number of cards you play - the multiplier decreases each round, so play as soon as you can for maximum points. The hard part is only being able to put cards in/on one meld each round. Buy the card you need by taking a penalty. Slap down a Wild to finish a meld or for extra points, but don't get stuck with one at the end!

Family friendly and a light game that can be played while waiting for takeaways or another game to finish. Play with two packs to expand to 7-10 players!

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: ALTNYC88
boardgame.description:
Publisher blurb:

ALTNYC88 is a slimmed TTRPG, risograph zine inspired by The Warriors, Early Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles and Escape from New York with a touch of supernatural weirdness. 20 pages in 3 colors crammed with setting and rules. The game is set in the late eighties in an alternative New York City. The players are part of one of the many gangs that operate in the subway, the sewers, and deeper down in the underworld. It’s a fast game full of mutants, ninjas, nunchucks, super villains, rats, slime, boom boxes and more!

boardgame.name: Free Willy
boardgame.description:
Publisher blurb:

Free Willy is the first supplement for ALTNYC88, a 2 color 16 page risograph zine, filled with adventure and intrigue regarding the mysterious Dr. Zeke, all set in the underworld of ALTNYC88!

boardgame.name: Flank!: Battle for Fairfield
boardgame.description:
The small border town of Fairfield is flanked on both sides by armies both claiming the town's riches.

Flank! is a light hearted strategy game for you and a mate.
Upgrade your warriors with Honors, flank your enemies and shout War Cries as you charge into battle!

On your turn you draw War Cry cards, select an Honor tile to upgrade one of your warriors, move your pieces into flanking positions and then fight your foes.
Fighting involves playing War Cry cards to turn the tides of battle and rolling dice based on the abilities of your pieces and those which are flanking your enemies.

Without a leader an army will fall and by defeating your opponents Champion you win the game.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: La Última Enfermera
boardgame.description:
La Última Enfermera is a game about the "crazy" work that nurses usually have to do. At this game each player represents a nurse at a job center, and one day they are called to start a work at the hospital on a random medical field, where they have to fulfill tasks.

At the beginning of the game each player is given a secret Identity Card (each of them related to a different field where you can work at, and each of them of different colour).

A deck is then formed with all the other cards (Task, Situation, Character and Item cards) shuffled. Each turn the player on turn has to draw a new card from the deck, add it to his hand (unless it's a Situation card, in which case it's resolved inmediately. Usually it's an event which changes something on the game, like shuffling all Identity cards of the players and re-dealing at random), and finally has to play or discard one card from it's hand.


Task cards can only be played (face down near the Identity card of that player) if it's a task of that type of work (it's of the same colour). If the card doesn't match your Identity card colour it has to be discarded.
Characters and Items are played to make it's special action.


The first player to have 5 Task cards of it's colour wins the game.

boardgame.name: BushPoo
boardgame.description:
You and your group of fellow travelers have spent a glorious day of climbing together, but now that you have reached the halfway point to the top of Mt Magnificent you have a huge problem.

That Big Breakfast you all enjoyed before setting out? Well the beans were a bit dodgy, and now everybody in the group needs to do a poo urgently.

Luckily there is a public toilet at the top of the mountain, but now you and your friends are going to have race to the top because if you don’t make it to the toilet in time you’re going to have to do a ...BushPoo!

In Bush Poo you and up to three of your friends will compete to be the first to the Golden throne at the top of the mountain.
Each turn you will be able to choose between moving one space, or moving two spaces, but be careful. When you move two spaces you must discard two cards from the deck of poo cards, and this can cause the game to end before anyone gets to the top!

When the Poo deck is down to the last five cards the game can end at any moment, because hidden in those last five cards is the poo explosion card! When the poo Explosion card is drawn the game ends, and the player that drew that card looses 5 points!
However, If you’re the first to make it to the golden toilet, and nobody draws the poo explosion card the Game ends and you get 10 points!

But that’s not the only way to get points and win the game. Look out for the leaf collection spaces. Whenever you move your pawn to a leaf collection spot you can draw the indicated number of leaf tokens from the token bag.

But Watch out, because you might draw a poo token! That means you must take a card from the poo card deck. Many of these cards are bad luck. some of the cards are helpful, and some of them are just fun.

-description from designer

boardgame.name: God Eater Resurrection - Predator Pack 1
boardgame.description:
Added 7 new Predator Styles

boardgame.name: Bone to Pick
Boomzie
boardgame.description:
Bone to Pick is a thrilling, fast paced semi-cooperative party game with multiple game modes. Battle against the undead in a Quick or Campaign game!
And if you want to "raise the bar" - try the Epic mode.

1668. The world as we knew it is gone. Millions of roaming undead have taken over most of 17th century Europe. You and a ragged band of survivors discovered an abandoned haven, a ghostly city with crumbling stone walls. You are few, low on supplies and an undead horde is drawing closer. You have to make your stand here it seems. Kill the abominations, gather their trophies, but also beware of your treacherous companions, or you will not survive the onslaught.

You’ll need the Weapon Decks and the Undead Deck for the Base Game. Before starting the game, draw 10 Undead Cards randomly; without knowing their order or strength; to create the Undead Deck and each player receives their own Weapon Deck of 12 cards.Each player places their card face down and turn them simultaneously.

The combined scores will tell whether you’ve lost the battle…
...or vanquished the enemy! The player who played the strongest Weapon Card can keep the defeated Undead Card as a trophy.

If your Haven has survived the onslaught, the next step is to sum up the strength of the remaining Weapon Cards and to add the value of the defeated Undead Cards Trophy Points player by player. The player with the highest score will become
the LEGEND.

If you have lost and your Haven was razed to the ground, sum up the strength of the remaining Weapon Cards. The player with the highest score will become
the SCAPEGOAT.

Campaign Mode enables players to fight the Undead in four waves, where each wave tis stronger than the previous one.
Players can upgrade their weapons after each wave and the best defenders will also gain extra rewards. At the end, if the Haven is still standing, the summed up scores of the four waves will determine the winner.

The game can be played up to 12 players with 2 core box.

-description from artist

boardgame.name: Anachrony Chess
boardgame.description:
In an alternate universe, the Paths of Anachrony are at war. This abstract, chess-style, two-player strategy game tells the story of one Path’s conquest of another, using Anachrony components and a print-and-play game board.

Just like in chess, your goal is to capture your opponent’s “King,” which in this game is represented by the Player banner—in other words, the Path’s “Flag.”

In this chess variant, the playing pieces will be your Exosuits, and the Workers you use to operate them will determine how they behave. What do you need for the next move? A Knight, a Rook, a Bishop, or maybe a Queen? Recruit the respective Worker from the Market for your chosen Exosuit with a bonus resource (like a Water or Energy core), and make your move!

Keep in mind that Workers are removed from used Exosuits after they move, so you’ll have to recruit new ones to operate them—unless, of course, you pay a Water to motivate the Worker to stay. If you have an empty Exosuit in danger or would like to move an Exosuit like a Pawn, you’ll find Energy cores are quite useful as well.

The print-and-play Anachrony Chess game board and the Rulebook are available for download at www.mindclashgames.com and the Files section of this BGG page.

boardgame.name: Peoples of the Crossroads Continent
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Welcome to the Crossroads Continent!

The Crossroads Continent is a vast land with marvelous diversity among its people. This book introduces a collection of folk who hail from the Crossroads Continent, providing new takes on familiar peoples while adding folk specific to the Crossroads Continent. Each entry provides not only game traits, but also an overview of that people's history, culture and settlements. The peoples in this collection can be used in your favorite 5e setting, or used to begin your own adventures in the Crossroads Continent using the rule set for the world's most popular roleplaying game!

Peoples of the Crossroads Continent contains:

11 distinct peoples to draw your character from, presented with information on their history in the Crossroads Continent
29 heritages to refine your character's history and upbringing
7 new regional backgrounds and 8 new cultural backgrounds to fully flesh out your character's backstory.

boardgame.name: The Outsider's Doom
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The pounding surf sings, matching the pounding in my mind.
Hard to think, easy to feel, but the Horn in my hands longs for the Outsider’s song, urges me to call to the deeps. The Doom waits, listens, hears. Soon, all within the hated city will feed the Doom and will dwell within the Outsider’s embrace.
Soon.
Soon.
I set the horn to my lips and blow.

The Outsider’s Doom is a dungeon and urban crawl adventure written for levels 1-5. In it, the players’ initial exploration of a desecrated dwarven tomb leads them to the High City of Slatewall, where conflicts between the city’s factions and riots that foreshadow an impending blood feud mask a dark plot by the cult of the forbidden Outsider to bring the entire city down into their god’s dark depths.

The campaign is designed to mix dungeons with investigatory social play as players unwrap deeper and deeper layers of treachery within the outwardly coherent society of the dwarves. However, individual sections of this module can also be used as independent one-shots telling a self-contained single-session story. The city of Slatewall itself is a busy, bustling location full of random encounters and multiple sites of interest and can be used as a locale in most campaigns.

Keystone: North America offers multiple ways to play! Go head-to-head against your friends in multiplayer and see who can build the healthiest ecosystem. Or experience a narrative adventure that will take you on a journey across North America with the Field Journal. This fully illustrated book contains a solo or co-op campaign where you will solve puzzles, learn about amazing animals, and explore the different ecosystems that make up North America.

Bandits that must be stopped. A community that wishes not to punish them, but to save them from themselves. A hillside fort, and a bandit ringleader hellbent with his hand on the switch to blow it all to the heavens.

Camp Cairn calls for players to fight and subdue bandits without killing them, and without giving a maniac an excuse to bring a fiery end to the whole operation. Lives are on the line, and no small amount of gold for each life saved. Adventure for a small group of low level 5e adventurers.

boardgame.name: The Clergy: Protectors of His Order
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Clergy is a divine spellcasting class that bridges the gap between casters and combat. They utilize a number of sacraments to cast magic burned into their skin in the form of scripture, while using the power of God to strike down anything that may stand against his divine order. Their responsibilities range from protecting churches, persons of divine interest or seeking out and destroying undead and other abominations within the world.

This release features three subclasses: the knight, the executor and the exorcist. Each focuses on different duties a member of the clergy should perform. From hunting down and killing heretics to banishing demons that have no place within God's world, they strike resolutely and with absolute certainty.

boardgame.name: Crimson Company: Wildwood Tales
boardgame.description:
The Wildwood Tales expansion adds a new set of mystical creatures to the Crimson Company roster. It also includes a 5-card set of vanilla cards without effects to make it easier to introduce new players to the game.

In Crimson Company, two opposing players take on the roles of adventurous noblemen in a cut-throat fantasy world. In a battle of wits, they assemble armies of sellswords, from hardened warriors and shady merchants to mythical creatures as old as time.

Your goal in a match of Crimson Company is to conquer two of the three castles in the center. You conquer a castle by amassing more strength than your opponent in the castle's lane by the time that lane is scored. A lane is scored once a player owns at least four cards in it.

Cards represent a large variety of characters, all of which have specific strength values and unique effects. The latter are either one-time instant effects that happen when a card is played, or they are triggered in specific phases of the game. Four randomly drawn cards from the character deck are "on offer". You may bid coins on only one of those at a time. Then your opponent decides to either pay you off, doubling the coins you bid, or pass and let you play the card.

-description from designer

boardgame.name: Formula BoardGame
boardgame.description:
Formula Board Game is a competitive, strategic / management board game for 2-5 players, which allows you to take part in a race of the highest car competition, reliving all the emotions of a Grand Prix.

The game simulates all aspects of a car race, acceleration and deceleration of the car, race strategy, pit stops, overtaking, variable weather, tire choice, crashes and of course damage.
In addition, the player through tokens has additional abilities such as sudden braking, instinct and additional gear changes, while through action cards that he can play during the turn, he adds attacks such as, risky overtaking, slipstreaming and delayed braking.

The game includes both the main cars of the players and the BotCars (cars that move independently during the race through special cards), each player controls an entire team during the race, then 2 cars, the main player car, which moves with its gear cards and the corresponding BotCar which moves autonomously, but which the player can help with additional movements through action cards.

Before starting the race, players will have to qualify for their main car, these are done through an application for Android smartphones, this is an absolute novelty in car racing themed board games, because it allows the player to actively interact , as the latter has to show his reaction skills to make the best qualifying time.

Subsequently, the team consisting of the 2 cars is purchased through an auction.
Subsequently the players, always through the Android application, will have to carry out a skill test to make the first movement of the departure, also this absolute novelty, which allows the player to simulate in a realistic way the emotion of the departure when the traffic light goes off.

The game takes place in several rounds, each round consists of 3 rounds, where the players must simultaneously place 3 marching cards in front of them in a secret way, respecting the acceleration and deceleration movement rules based on the weather. For example, with the sun weather the acceleration is maximum +3 and the deceleration is maximum -2, with rain weather it is maximum +2 and the deceleration is maximum -2, but they must also pay attention to the entry and exit limits. always turns according to the weather.

During the race the BotCar cars are always in play, even if you play with 2 players, so you will always have a minimum of 7 cars in the race and a maximum of 10 cars if you play with 5.

The game is a simulation, luck is totally non-existent, the 10 moving gear cards that the player has in his hand are the same for all players, so only the player's strategic skill can lead to victory.

The race ends when all the cars in the last round have crossed the finish line, the winner will be established according to the sum of the points scored by the 2 cars of the team calculated based on the finish position.


Formula Board Game è un gioco da tavolo competitivo, strategico/gestionale per 2-5 giocatori, che permette di prendere parte ad una gara della massima competizione automobilistica, rivivendo tutte le emozioni di un Gran Premio.
Il gioco simula tutti gli aspetti di una gara automobilistica, accelerazione e decelerazione della macchina, la strategia di gara, i pit stop, i sorpassi, il meteo variabile, la scelta degli pneumatici, incidenti e ovviamente i danni.
Inoltre il giocatore attraverso dei token ha delle abilità aggiuntive come frenata improvvisa, istinto e cambi marcia aggiuntivi, mentre attraverso delle carte azione che può giocare durante il turno, aggiunge attacchi come, sorpassi azzardati, la scia e la staccata ritardata.
Il gioco comprende sia le auto principali dei giocatori, sia le BotCar (auto che si muovono autonomamente durante la gara attraverso delle carte apposite), ogni giocatore controlla durante la gara un team intero, quindi 2 auto, l'auto principale giocatore, che muove con le sue carte marcia e la BotCar corrispondente che si muove autonomamente, ma che il giocatore può aiutare con dei movimenti aggiuntivi attraverso le carte azione.
Prima di iniziare la gara i giocatori dovranno effettuare le qualifiche per la propria auto principale, queste vengono effettuate attraverso un'applicazione per smartphone Android, questa è un'assoluta novità nei giochi da tavolo a tema corse automobilistiche, perché permette al giocatore di interagire attivamente, in quanto quest'ultimo deve dare prova delle sue abilità di reazione per effettuare il miglior tempo di qualifica.
Successivamente si procede all'acquisto del team composto dalle 2 auto attraverso un'asta.
Successivamente i giocatori, dovranno effettuare sempre attraverso l'applicazione Android, una prova di abilità per effettuare il primo movimento della partenza, anche questa assoluta novità, che permette al giocatore di simulare in modo realistico l'emozione della partenza allo spegnimento del semaforo.
Il gioco si svolge in vari round, ogni round è formato da 3 turni, dove i giocatori contemporaneamente devono posizionare davanti a se 3 carte marcia in maniera segreta, rispettando le regole movimento di accelerazione e decelerazione in base al meteo. Ad esempio con il meteo sole l'accelerazione è di massimo +3 e la decelerazione e di massimo -2, con meteo pioggia è di massimo +2 e la decelerazione di massimo -2, ma devono fare anche attenzione ai limiti di entrata e uscita curva sempre in base al meteo.
Durante la gara le auto BotCar sono sempre in gioco, anche se si gioca in 2 giocatori, quindi in gara si avranno sempre un minimo di 7 auto e un massimo di 10 auto se si gioca in 5.
Il gioco è una simulazione, la fortuna è totalmente inesistente, le 10 carte marcia movimento che il giocatore ha in mano sono uguali per tutti i giocatori, quindi solo la bravura strategica del giocatore può portare alla vittoria.
La gara termina quando tutte le auto nell'ultimo round hanno attraversato il traguardo, il vincitore verrà stabilito secondo la somma dei punti effettuati dalle 2 auto del team calcolati in base alla posizione di arrivo.

boardgame.name: Peníze: Jak rozmnožit peníze
boardgame.description:
Peníze ("Money") is a management game in which real Czech companies and banks are included. The rules of the game respect the laws of real business and securities trading. The game shows what economic conditions affect the values of securities, for which companies are better bet on dividends and for which it is worth speculating to buy and sell shares.

Players roll dice, then they move figure by that many spaces. When they enter company area, you check actual state of game, find of how much company dividents rise or decrease, then they can buy them.
When game ends players decide before actual game starts. Players can agree that game end at 2 hour timer and who will own most of money wins or they can agree on money limit to reach for win.

Peníze jsou manažerská hra, ve které jsou obsaženy skutečné české firmy a banky. Pravidla hry respektují zákonitosti reálného podnikání a obchodování s cennými papíry. Hra ukazuje, jaké ekonomické podmínky ovlivňují hodnoty cenných papírů, u kterých podniků je lépe vsadit na dividendy a u kterých se vyplatí spekulovat s koupí a prodejem akcií.

Hráči házejí kostkami a poté o tolik míst posouvají figurku. Když vstoupí do oblasti společnosti, zkontrolujete skutečný stav hry, zjistíte, o kolik se dividendy společnosti zvýší nebo sníží, a pak si je mohou koupit.
Po skončení hry se hráči rozhodnou před zahájením skutečné hry. Hráči se mohou dohodnout, že hra končí ve 2hodinovém časovači a kdo bude vlastnit většinu peněz, vyhrává, nebo se mohou dohodnout na peněžním limitu, aby dosáhli na výhru.

boardgame.name: Forsaken System Player's Guide
Sistema Perduto - Guida del Giocatore
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

EXPLORE A SYSTEM FORSAKEN BY THE GREAT RIFT

Cut off from the might of the Imperium by the Great Rift, and beset on all sides by the daemonic forces that emerge from the tear in reality, the Gilead System stands as a bastion of faith in the Emperor. Unable to call for reinforcements or escape the System, the citizens of these planets fight to preserve the Imperial Creed as they battle back the vile xenos, corrupted renegades, and foul daemons that assail them.

But even as the Imperium’s diverse factions unite in this time of desperation, the rifts between them grow. With the Emperor’s watchful gaze obscured by the Great Rift, powerful opportunists pursue their own goals, and reignite old rivalries. The grim worlds of the Gilead System are rife with intrigue, betrayal, and secretive plots.

The Forsaken System Player’s Guide contains a wealth of information for running and playing Warhammer 40,000 Roleplay: Wrath & Glory, including:

Expanded information on the planets of the Gilead System, including optional backgrounds for Human characters.
Practical primers on the fractious Factions of the Gilead System, their hierarchies, and their relationships with one another.
Detailed accounts of the Patrons of the major Factions in the Gilead System, each of which has distinct Frameworks and mission ideas for your campaign.
3 new playable Species: Ogryns, Ratlings, and Kroot.
20 new playable Archetypes.
Optional rules for a system of downtime Endeavours to detail your characters’ exploits between adventures.

boardgame.name: Elbűvölő Magyarország kvízjáték
boardgame.description:
A game of amazing curiosities and essential knowledge that will build on the well-known Trivia board games. A variety of questions await the player!

What are the things everyone needs to know about their homeland? Put yourself to the test with the enchanting Hungary quiz game, which guides you through cultures, from the best-known traditions and sayings to the most interesting facts, if you go through different topics!

Topics:

History
Culture
Science and nature
Geography
Sports
Mixed
Plant the whole family for a new, shared experience where everyone can learn something.
How much are you in the picture?

Everyone plays at once, so no one gets bored!
Multiple choice puzzles to make fun for everyone!

boardgame.name: Elbűvölő Magyarország Junior
boardgame.description:
A version of the famous Glamorous Hungary quiz game for younger children! We recommend the game from the age of 7

How well do you know your homeland? Lots of little things are subconsciously built from our culture into our personalities, but there are even more things worth knowing about our home with a thousand faces! Here is a great opportunity to discover Hungary and stand out from the others with your knowledge, gaining the glorious victory! Test yourself on 6 different topics, answer correctly and pocket the points! Quiz up!

Sit down with the whole family for a new, shared experience where everyone can learn something.
How much are you in the picture?

Everyone plays at once, so no one gets bored!
Multiple choice puzzles to make fun for everyone!

boardgame.name: #Maradj Otthon!
boardgame.description:
#Maradj otthon! ("Stay Home") is a simple and fast-paced party game that is great fun for all ages. The original game was created by Ms. Lenhardt Kwaysser Fatime, winner of the 2020 Super Teacher Award, during her quarantine for her own class, and was later further developed with the help of the Blue Game. The year 2020 has left us with a lot of bad feelings and memories, but it is important that we can laugh despite the difficulties.

The goal of the game, which can be played by 2-6 people, is to preserve our cold blood and overcome the obstacles in front of us in the constantly changing conditions. Collect all 19 points! During the game, they could step on a special game board that could change at any moment, creating a whole new situation for the players. When collecting points, don't forget about the mask and hand sanitizer! Funny quarantine cards will help or hinder us during our mission.

If we come together from time to time to defeat the virus together, we can also play with the semi-cooperative game mode: here too we collect points for ourselves, but in the meantime we also have to pay close attention to the threatening virus so that it does not outgrow us! We can only defeat it by working together together if we are willing to make sacrifices and give up the points we have already earned. In the game, we tried to smuggle a lot of humor in addition to the current problems, to solve the limitations and annoyances of everyday life.

Masks produced, have fun!

—description from the publisher (translated)

boardgame.name: Brúnó Budapesten: Városnézés
boardgame.description:
The Sightseeing board game presents Budapest to the preschool and primary school age group on four large boards. It is the smallest of the four games of different difficulty and theme, and those who can already read will find it age-appropriate. The game guides both Budapesters and non-Budapesters through the capital.

The Brúnó in Budapest board game contains 4 different games that are related to the book series Brúnó in Budapest.

The rules are simple and easy to follow in all 4 games and can be played in an average of 15-20 minutes.

Simplified, Erika Bartos's drawings introduce children to Budapest's famous buildings and public spaces in a perfectly recognizable way. The game is also suitable for children who like transport and means of transport.

The cube-based vehicle game is easy even for the little ones: the winner is the first to collect the six vehicles.

The second board is a classic party, where the winner will be the first to get from Vajdahunyad Castle to the Elizabeth Lookout Tower.

In the third game, we have to go around the border of the capital, and the surrounding settlements and the building drawings on the map and the numbers and boundaries of the districts help to get to know our capital.

The fourth answer table builds on the knowledge of Budapest.

The game is recommended for 3-10 year olds. It can be played by 2 to 8 players.

boardgame.name: The Pratzen: Austerlitz, 1805
boardgame.description:
The Pratzen: Austerlitz 1805 is a two-player board game that portrays the fighting on and around the Pratzen Heights at the Battle of Austerlitz. The battle was fought between the French forces of Napoleon Bonaparte and a larger allied army composed of Austrian and Russian forces. The battle is considered to be one of the most important and decisive engagements of the Napoleonic Wars. The engagement result brought the War of the Third Coalition to an end and about the Treaty of Pressburg. The battle is widely thought of as a tactical masterpiece on par with Cannae.

The game is designed by industry veteran and author of The Art of Wargaming, Peter P. Perla. The game system of The Pratzen: Austerlitz 1805 began some three decades ago as an idea to update the classic SPI tactical game Grenadier, published in 1971. Pratzen evolved into a merger of the Grenadier scale with some different combat mechanics based on the original von Reisswitz Kriegsspiel rules of 1824, adopted as a training tool in the Prussian army after the Napoleonic Wars. The scale was shifted from half-battalions to companies and divisions as the basic infantry maneuver piece, and much additional streamlining and simplification ensued.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Carcassonne: 20 Jaar Jubileumeditie

boardgame.description:
Carcassonne is a tile-placement game in which the players draw and place a tile with a piece of southern French landscape on it. The tile might feature a city, a road, a cloister, grassland or some combination thereof, and it must be placed adjacent to tiles that have already been played, in such a way that cities are connected to cities, roads to roads, etcetera. Having placed a tile, the player can then decide to place one of their meeples on one of the areas on it: on the city as a knight, on the road as a robber, on a cloister as a monk, or on the grass as a farmer. When that area is complete, that meeple scores points for its owner.

During a game of Carcassonne, players are faced with decisions like: "Is it really worth putting my last meeple there?" or "Should I use this tile to expand my city, or should I place it near my opponent instead, giving him a hard time to complete their project and score points?" Since players place only one tile and have the option to place one meeple on it, turns proceed quickly even if it is a game full of options and possibilities.

Carcassonne: 20th Anniversary Edition is a special edition of Carcassonne to celebrate the 20th anniversary of its Spiel des Jahres win in 2001. This edition includes the tiles from the Carcassonne base game, "The River" mini-expansion (with five new river tiles), "The Abbot" mini-expansion, and a new 15-tile "anniversary" mini-expansion. All tiles are adorned with UV-print, with many detailed easter eggs being hidden in the art. Costume stickers are included in case you wish to "dress" your meeples.

All contents are compatible with existing and future Carcassonne releases.

boardgame.name: Liberation: Moon of Mystery
boardgame.description:
The Athena Colony isn't quite what it seems. Disguised as a run of the mill spaceport...

A 2-card expansion that introduces a new map card and a new ability.

boardgame.name: Trumpopoly: The Geopolitical Board Game
boardgame.description:
An exciting new game in which you collect electors, buy states and collect electoral votes to win the White House.

The game features intelligently designed board squares along with two types of cards. VOTE cards are pulled at every turn, resulting in gain or loss of electors. MAGA cards have various social and political circumstances which affect your candidate.

The game rules intelligently integrate the game elements in a way that creates levels of decision making. This includes buy no buy decisions for states, strategy for dice rolls and decisions about swing states

The game includes funny plot twists like getting a “Rudy” card to avoid an indictment and creatively designed elector dollars festooned with electoral colleges members. Future plans include expansion packs for each election, including cards designed around the political social climate and events of that time.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: The Darkness Beneath Brightwell Manor (5E)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The reclusive Brightwell family has been corrupted by the whispers of a vengeful sorceress-turned-fiend. When this newfound master suddenly grows silent, the madness infecting the household is no longer focused, and cannot be contained. Mayhem spills across the countryside.

Meanwhile, deep below the Brightwell estate, the family’s patriarch Eldon Brightwell inflicts horrifying experiments on both servants and family...

Content Warning: Violence, death/dying, blood, supernatural horror, torture

A house of horrors-style adventure for 4-6 characters of tier 2 (levels 5-10) using the 5th edition of the world's most popular roleplaying game.

The Darkness Beneath Brightwell Manor is a creepy crawl through a noble's estate that has become the scene of ghastly experiments with oozes. Driven insane by the mad speech of a demon, the manor's patriarch has begun a terrifying plot to destroy nearby Dalentown.

Although this adventure includes everything you need to know to run it as a standalone, you can pick up DD-01 The Darkness Beneath Dalentown for additional plot threads or even to connect some of the lower-level dungeons!

This adventure features:

An 18 page adventure using a concise, easy to reference landscape layout to make running the adventure even easier.
A 40+ page appendices guide with magic items and monsters laid out so that you can easily print and cut them out for arranging as player handouts, initiative cards, or to arrange by encounter!
An appendix of lists to make preparation even easier.
Links to all magic items and monsters in the adventure text, so you can reference SRD stats and format them to your own wishes.
Magic items and monsters sourced from dozens of OGL releases, so you'll get use out of all those 3rd party books you own, or discover something new! Either way, you have all the information at your fingertips in this adventure.
Cartography by Dyson Logos and a small hex map using Inkwell Ideas' Worldographer.
Easily set in any fantasy RPG campaign setting, but with enough ties to Adventures in Dalentown to give you easy room for expansion, or just an easy place to start!

boardgame.name: Lost Temples of Qaarra
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Lost temples of Qaarra Await!

Over a century has passed since the catastrophe of Qaarra and the abandonment of its temples. The memories of these temples have faded to legends written on dusty scrolls. Adventurers could gain wealth and fame by journeying into the lost temples. However, who knows what mysteries and dangers might lurk there!

Lost Temples of Qaarra is a supplement for Four Against Darkness, featuring:

New d66 dungeon tiles.
New room features.
Lower dungeon floor levels.
New mechanics for Stairs, Scrying Pools, Altars.
New magic items including the Rod of Resurrection.
New monsters: tainted aspect, crystal guardian, hairy mimic, meat-eating moss, flying reptiles, temple automatons, cursed corpse, archdaemon, stone terror, gigantic gorilla, temple cleaner, cursed priest and more!
A new Final Boss type, the temple guardian.
New traps, scrolls, secrets and treasure.
Hardcore play rules for die-hard players.
Two new classes: the artificer and the crystalmancer.

boardgame.name: Module 3: The Present Past, Part 1
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The late 21st century has never looked so grim, but it's not without hope.

Welcome to The Orichite Age, an episodic expansion series to the critically acclaimed Entromancy: A Cyberpunk Fantasy RPG. Over the course of several brand new modules, The Orichite Age will bring players from a cybertech-dominated future to a magic-rich past, with new stories, character options, gear, cybernetics, adversaries, and encounters.

Module 3: The Present Past, Part 1 introduces the Auromancer, a hybrid magical- and melee-based class that utilizes the power of sound to deal devastating damage and generate protective shields. Module 3: The Present Past, Part 1 then uses the Struct system to offer a brand new adventure path that prepares players, and their factions, for a chaotic and dangerous expedition through the centuries and into a war-torn Orichite Age, continued in Module 4: The Present Past, Part 2.

boardgame.name: Module 4: The Present Past, Part 2
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The late 21st century has never looked so grim, but it's not without hope.

Welcome to The Orichite Age, an episodic expansion series to the critically acclaimed Entromancy: A Cyberpunk Fantasy RPG. Over the course of several brand new modules, The Orichite Age will bring players from a cybertech-dominated future to a magic-rich past, with new stories, character options, gear, cybernetics, adversaries, and encounters.

Module 4: The Present Past, Part 2 introduces the Chronomancer, a powerfully magical new Destiny that harnesses time magic. Module 4: The Present Past, Part 2 then uses the Struct system to empower players, and their factions, to pick up where they left off in Module 3: The Present Past, Part 1, following through on their chaotic and dangerous expedition into a war-torn Orichite Age.

boardgame.name: Cantaloop: Book 2 – A Hack of a Plan
Cantaloop: Buch 2 – Ein ausgehackter Plan
boardgame.description:
After the chaotic, but successful, events in part 1, "A hack of a plan", the game continues right away. Oz "Hook" Carpenter has gathered his team and his goals are set. Just one thing is still missing: Use the unique abilities of your team in order to create a rock-solid revenge plan against the biggest crook of town. Explore beautifully illustrated locations, talk to characters and solve tricky puzzles in this "Point'n'Click" like game. Search and collect items, figure out where to use them and combine them with each other. Do you have what it takes? Find out in Cantaloop * An interactive adventure book!


Open World: You decide where you want to go and when.
Non-Linear Puzzle Design: There's always at least two puzzles to solve at any given time, so chances that you'll get stuck are minimized.
6-10 hours Playtime: Or 18-30 hours for the entire trilogy * a huge game world to immerse yourself in.
Story-driven: In the prologue (download the Print & Play at lookout-spiele.de) and the 3 parts of the game, the story slowly ramps up to the big heist on Cantaloop Island.
Humor: Similar to the old point & click adventure games, you'll get a funny response for a lot of the combinations you try.
Non-Destructive: None of the game material gets destroyed in your playthrough. There is only one sheet of paper that you can easily copy.
Help System: Should you get stuck, there is a vast help section where you can get up to two hints and the solution to any puzzle.
No Abstract Puzzles: Every puzzle fits into the world and story of Cantaloop.
Dialogues: Most of Cantaloop's story is told in speech bubbles, encouraging player groups to roleplay the scenes together.
Secrets: There MAY be a few easter eggs and unlockables sprinkled throughout Cantaloop, but I'm sure that's just hearsay.


—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Gravitas
boardgame.description:
Gravitas is a gravity-based puzzle-platformer set in a futuristic art gallery in space. You experience the art by manipulating the laws of physics and moving cubes. It's not that complicated, just go play it.

In the Gallery of Refined Gravity, pupils have to use their gravity-shooting glove to experience brilliant artistic works. If they want to live, they need to not be stupid. They get to control gravity fields, interact with cubes, put the cubes IN the gravity fields, and sometimes die since there are occasionally death beams.

FEATURES

Create Gravity Fields with my super fancy Gravity Glove, and then... I don't know, use them to jump longer or something.
Demonstrate partial dominance over the known universe by using gravity to move skillfully through my pieces. You must cooperate with cubes to progress, for they bow to no one.
Cross the gorgeous oceans of death by leeching off the strength of a superior object.
Break that crazy expensive glass the museum just acquired. This is why we can't have nice things, bad juju.
Open doors with your face, since apparently things just STAY BROKEN around here.


Source: The Game Website.

boardgame.name: Hats On
boardgame.description:
This is a simple children's dice game. Move around a board to acquire clothes and be the first person to dress a figure.

Players select an underwear clad male or female two dimensional figure and must add six pieces of clothing: shirt; trousers/skirt/shorts; sock; shoes; sweater; and a hat.

The game comes with multiple clothing variants, as well as a blank template for users to create their own.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Comment Below...
boardgame.description:
A rotating judge places a Status card on top of their chosen profile card while the rest of the group competes to play the funniest Comment card. Once everyone has submitted their chosen comment card face down, the judge awards a point to the funniest one. The person who has the most status states at the end of the game is the winner.

Contains: 75 Profile cards, 90 Status cards, 270 Comment cards, a super fancy easel, plus instructions.

boardgame.name: The Well
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book:

The Well is a fun, lightweight roleplaying game of exploring dungeons, finding treasures, and collecting grievous wounds.

From the city of Bastion, buried underground beneath endless layers of crypts...

...you delve upward, fighting undead abominations formed from the bones of your own ancestors.

How high can you go?

boardgame.name: Isle d' Scetto Porto Napoli Atlas and Adventure Unit
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A 61 page atlas and adventure , with political intrigue, three ancient ruins, lots of NPC characters and fighters. The player characters have the opportunity to stop others from looting an ancient site. This adventure also has options for the Game-master to spin of their own adventures.
boardgame.rpg: Planet Archipelago: A Medieval Science Fiction Role-Play Game

boardgame.name: Legendary Mesmerists: Second Edition
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Look Into My Eyes!

Legendary Mesmerists is the latest volume in our new series of class-focused player supplements for Pathfinder Second Edition, this time focused on the mind-bending mesmerist class. These devious tricksters and students of occult psychology wield the power of pure thought to unlock the secrets of the mind while imposing their will on anyone that dares to meet their hypnotic gaze. You’ll find over 150 class options for this new class, including a massive array of class feats for every level from offensive talents like Amplify Pain, Devastating Invective, and Petrifying Stare to incredible utility powers like Chain of Eyes, Contingent Trick, Spatial Switch, and Fanatical Sacrifice. Shape your character’s approach to mental magic with knacks like the alluring arriviste, the spirit walker, or the psychic balm of the solacer, and with new backgrounds like the esoterist, astrologically blessed, or the guinea pig! Plus you get new rules for occult skill unlocks in Pathfinder Second Edition like Dowsing, Aura Reading, and Exorcism! And new magic items! And three sample characters to show off how the options of the class or to drop into your campaign as richly developed NPCs.

boardgame.name: Hollowcell
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This game supplement covers "The Hollowcell", a new boss to fight against your players. 5e, Pathfinder RPG, Hexagon RPG and system-neutral compatible rules included.


All the contents inside this product are meant to be used as stand-alone material for the "Hollowcell" game tool or inside of your ongoing campaigns by reskinning and adapting them to best fit your games.

boardgame.name: Galaxy Far Away: Ultralite Star Wars
boardgame.description:
Author's blurb:

Galaxy Far Away is a free, fan-made, ultralite RPG based on the Star Wars universe for one referee and one or more players. Character creation is flexible and narrative, with no numbers involved save for a few die rolls for starting gear, credits, and potential Force sensitivity.

Treat the world as a real place. Lean into what you know about the given setting. The referee is neutral and plays to see what happens as much as the players do. Reasonable action happens as described. Risk and impact are adjudicated by the referee. Trust each other to be fair. Act in good faith.

The vast majority of situations will not require a dice contest, but merely a judgement call to resolve. Players and their characters leverage their environment, use common sense, and clearly describe their actions. Consequences follow accordingly.

If it is unclear if a player's action will succeed, or if grave risk is involved, the referee declares the probable impact and rolls 2d6. Then the player character most at risk rolls also 2d6.

- If the player rolls higher, their character succeeds
- If the referee rolls higher, something bad happens
- If they tie, the character succeeds AND something bad happens

Whatever happens, the referee describes the impact.

boardgame.name: Moment of Peace
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Armed with a ritual that will let them track the Wyrmskull Throne, the characters travel to distant mountain, magical desert, and the Outer Planes--but all their success might yet be undone by a vengeful enemy.

Part Four of the Storm King’s Descent series of adventures.

A six-hour adventure for Tier 3 characters.
boardgame.rpgseries: DDAL - Dreams of the Red Wizards

boardgame.name: Assassination in Oeble
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The scion of The Drakefang has disappeared! Rumors of assassination quickly sweep over the lands of The Swordpoint Streams. Lady Mezmra Irondrake calls to adventurers to discover her daughter’s fate and bring her home, dead-or-alive! Can they find answers in a violence-ridden town or uncover a truth better kept underground?

A Two-Hour to Four-Hour Adventure for Characters of 1st – 4th Level

boardgame.name: The Girl with the Wet Nose
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Some evils never die. Only the fuzziest heroes have enough lives to end the threat.

A Four-Hour Adventure for Characters of 1st – 4th Level

boardgame.name: Secrets in Storage
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Every year, the town of Sorndorn auctions off the contents of storage vaults belonging to anonymous owners who have defaulted on their rent. Among this year’s auction is one vault that may hold crucial information regarding the latest threat to the Border Kingdoms, attracting those who wish to obtain this information to further their own agendas. Only the keenest of eyes and shrewdest of skills will be able to discern the valuables from the pile of rubbish.

A Two- to Four-Hour Adventure for Characters of 1st – 4th Level

boardgame.name: Rangers of Shadow Deep: Menagerie
boardgame.description:
During a mission into enemy territory, the rangers are ambushed by a strange assortment of wild beasts, pursued by their Shadow Deep handlers. Can the rangers survive the onslaught, and then turn the tables on their attackers? And can they discover the secrets of the enemy wagon train before it escapes back into the darkness?

Rangers of Shadow Deep: Menagerie is a mini-supplement featuring one mission with two scenarios. Also included are nine new animal companions that rangers can recruit to join them on their adventures.
boardgame.boardgamecompilation: Exploradores de las Profundidades Sombrías. Compendio de Aventuras 1
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Rangers of Shadow Deep: Deluxe Edition

boardgame.name: A Mural of Arthyn
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The artist Diego Orozco has painted a mural in the town square of Arthyn. Yesterday, a small child threw a rock at the mural. Today, a boulder falls from the sea cliffs, smashing the shipyard! Sensing an opportunity, the townsfolk gather to debate how best to use this magical mural – if at all. But without a leader to guide them, the town’s debate will quickly turn into chaos.

A Four-Hour Adventure for Characters of 5th – 10th Level

boardgame.name: Duskwood Wild Magic Pools
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The wild magic pools of the Duskwood are the stuff of legends but these pools lie deep in the heart of the magical forest. Few adventurers travel there and even fewer return.

A Two-Hour to Four-Hour Adventure for Characters of 5th – 10th Level

boardgame.name: Sour in Splondar
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The Splondarren Harvest Festival is about to begin, and the cream of the Border Kingdoms nobility will be on hand to taste the region’s finest ales. But a mysterious illness strikes the festgoers and threatens the lives of even the well-guarded nobles. Can the adventurers discover the source of the affliction in time?

A Four-Hour Adventure for Characters of 5th – 10th Level

boardgame.name: Once Stolen, Twice Deceived
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Rumors of sightings of the undead Lord High Mages of Adaerglast outside of their castle prison are spreading across the Border Kingdoms, striking fear among the common people and worry among the greatest wizards of the Realms. While attending a nearby celebration, the characters are tasked with apprehending the liches and sealing them away once more.

A Four-Hour Adventure for Characters of 11th – 16th Level

boardgame.name: The Archmage's New Robes
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

You have been called to the aid of the Mage Rymdyl before, but never to act as her escort to the famed Fashion Week in Blackalblade. Time to put on your finest clothes and prepare for the dangers of high fashion in the back alleys of the Border Kingdom’s cutting edge of fashion.

A Four-Hour Adventure for Characters of 11th – 16th Level

boardgame.name: A Convergence of Gods
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The area known as Godswalk Keep has been showing signs of activity. Are the Bloodreavers really working towards bringing back Garagos and restoring him to divine status? Only true heroes of the Border Kingdoms can stop them. This is a Tier 4 adventure optimized for APL 18, and is a stand alone adventure for the Border Kingdoms.

A Four-Hour Adventure for Characters of 17th – 20th Level

boardgame.name: Yaza's House of Horrors
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A short fantasy dungeon adventure of a light-hearted and spooky romp through a haunted funhouse. Give your players thrills and chills as they put their lives on the line for treasure!

boardgame.name: The Red Rum Runners
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The Red Rum Runners is designed for a party of four to six level-two characters. It features read-a-loud text for ease of use and maps designed for use on virtual tabletops, such as Roll20 and Fantasy Grounds.

Adventure Overview

A murder of harpies in a nearby forest is raising cockatrices in order to use their blood and other body parts as ingredients in potions that they sell on the black market. They are also creating an illicit drug called Red Rum that is being sold in the nearby village of Dungleburg.

Recently, several cockatrices escaped from their pens and descended upon Dungleburg, petrifying several gnomes and ripping apart one of them as a meal. Naturally, the residents of the village are now looking for someone to help them with this issue.

boardgame.name: Ties & Lies
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Have you ever wanted to be part of a megacorporation? Have you ever wanted to climb the corporate ladder at any cost? Have you ever wanted all the money, yet none of the time to enjoy it? … No? Well… now you do, so get with the program.
...
Players assume the role of ambitious Interns, battling in meeting rooms for the position of CEO. One OTHER player is the ominous Board of Directors. Your goal is to fix the problems The Board of Directors will be throwing at you, earning promotions and being the first Player to reach the position of CEO— before firing everyone else!

Sabotage others, interrupt their speech, disprove their math (even if it’s right), or even put the moves on The Board! Do whatever you need to do in order to win! But… be careful. If you upset The Board, you might find The Company has been liquated.

boardgame.name: Masters of The Universe: Fields of Eternia The Board Game – King Hsss on Tyrantisaurus
boardgame.description:
King Hsss rides into battle atop a Tyrantisaurus, armed with a shoulder-mounted cannon and razor-sharp teeth. When the techno-organic virus spread through Eternia, the dinosaur that lived there began to grow robotic limbs and weapons.

Package contains:

1x King Hsss on Tyrantisaurus limited miniature with scenic base integrated
1x game card

Item is available in Europe only.

boardgame.name: Scrapped Princess RPG
スクラップド・プリンセスRPG
boardgame.description:
User summary:

Scrapped Princess is a Japanese light novel series and media franchise. The series blends high fantasy, post-apocalypse, and science fantasy elements. Characters usually are light-hearted in personality, contrasting with a more seriously-toned background setting.

The media franchise has been adapted as a tabletop roleplaying game.

Publisher's blurb:

『スクラップド・プリンセス』の舞台ダストヴィン大陸を自由に冒険しよう！

大人気ファンタジー『すてプリ』がTRPG化！基本システムには『ソード・ワールドRPG』の2d6システムを採用。身近な街の事件から竜機神や秩序守護者相手の世界を揺るがす大事件まで、幅広い冒険を楽しもう

boardgame.name: A World of Sand and Fire
boardgame.description:
A storytelling game about the Dark Sun setting

From the introduction:

At the start of play, you will create two Primary Characters. One of these should be more positive of a character, and one more negative. But both should be interesting characters that you want to see doing stuff in the world of Athas. The two characters may or may not be working together or opposed to one another.

User summary:

The game is published as two PDF files:

8-page game document
4-page print-and-play cards
boardgame.rpg: A World of Sand and Fire

boardgame.name: Monopoly: Fribourg / Freiburg
boardgame.description:
Monopoly, the world famous land and real estate game, takes you through the beautiful old town of Fribourg. Listening to the two native languages, lingering comfortably in a medieval city or enjoying one of the most beautiful views into the distance from the 74 meter high cathedral tower - this can only be done in Fribourg. But go on a journey of discovery yourself.

You dreamed of owning the Saint-Nicolas cathedral, building a hotel in Courtepin or buying the Dent-de-Broc? Players can buy the St. Nicholas Cathedral, the Poya Bridge or Lake Murten.

Only 3500 editions made and it is in French and German.

boardgame.name: Monopoly: Vaud
boardgame.description:
Monopoly, the world famous land and real estate game, takes you through the canton of Vaud.
You dreamed of owning the Chaplin museum, building a hotel on the Glacier 3000 ?
Players can buy the golf course of Villars, the towns of Nyon, Montreux or Vevey, or even the castle of Aigle. Be careful to avoid the Bois-Mermet prison though!

boardgame.name: Flames of War: Firestorm Campaign – Cherbourg & St. Lô, Normandy part II
boardgame.description:
Firestorm: Cherbourg & St. Lô covers the US Sector of the Normandy campaign.

Firestorm campaigns give players the opportunity to play Flames Of War games in a larger context and give every game a greater meaning.

boardgame.name: Lottery Fever
boardgame.description:
The object of the game is to either accumulate $1 million in winnings or match all six "Big Deal Lotto" numbers on their card.

Each player takes one score card that has three lottery games on it: Triple Play, 4-Play and Big Deal Lotto. They are then given $40,000 to start play.

Through rolling a die and moving around the board, players can play various lottery games in an effort to accumulate the $1 million goal, or earn or lose money on event spaces (i.e. - Auto Accident, Pay College Tuition, Inheritance, etc.). On each of those spaces, the amount won or lost is determined by the number they roll after landing on the space. If a player cannot afford to pay a penalty, they can either pay what they have or pay nothing and miss their next turn, but no player is ever eliminated from the game.

In Triple Play, a player pays $400 to the bank and chooses one of the Triple Play number sets on their card and roll three dice up to three times trying to match those numbers. If successful, their winnings are based on how many turns it took out of the three to match the numbers. If they are unsuccessful, they win nothing and their turn is over.

4-Play is the same as Triple Play, but with higher payouts, and the player rolls four dice up to four times. They also pay $500 to play it.

Big Deal Lotto requires a $1,000 payment, and the player rolls one die. If the roll matches a number on their card, they cover it with a chip and and are on step closer to winning.

Players may also join in on another player's lottery by being the first to shout "Big Money", but risk paying that player if they are unsuccessful in the lottery being played. There is also an "Investment" space where players can put up between $1,000 and $10,000 in an effort to multiply their winnings.

For a longer game, winning requires a player to both acquire at least $1 million, as well as match all six of their Big Deal Lotto numbers.

boardgame.name: D100 Dungeon: The Dragons Return
boardgame.description:
D100 Dungeon: The Dragons Return contains campaign quest 2 which is set in the continent of Westpoint. It is the second campaign book released for D100 Dungeon and follows on from the campaign named “The Goblin and the Goblet”, which features in the Adventurers Companion book.

Also included is Martial Artistry that combines new advanced weaponry and unarmed combat, and a new Encounter table EB with 36 new monsters and a new Monster Ability. The new table incorporates the two previously released Encounter tables (E and EA) so you can experience a highly varied range of monsters in your games.

—description from the designer

The All-In-One box includes the Aristeia! Core Box and the Prime Time box, the expansion that adds all the rules and necessary materials to allow up to 4 players to join the fun, and new scenarios and Aristeia-compatible game elements, such as objective cards, running projectiles and more.

boardgame.name: Powerplay: Ice Hockey
boardgame.description:
Powerplay: Ice Hockey is a fun and exciting sports game that simulates the events of a game of ice hockey. The game builds around an area impulse system found in various wargames in which players take turns, divided in impulses, to score a goal. With this, both players may act and react to actions taken by the opponent. But beware, you'll never know when your turn ends. The game uses dice and card to resolve most actions with multiple options for both sides. Build your own team, use different tactics and manage your strategy to win. Powerplay: Ice Hockey has two different modes, play either an exhibition game or a tournament.

Skating, passing, checking and shooting are some of the actions included. The game also has different player abilities, video reviews, referee personalities, line changes, penalties, fatigue, injuries etc. Use Push Tokens to press your luck and pit your checking line against your opponent's 1st line. Focus is on Team play, not on individual players. Each side has a Team Card with different ratings such as skating, passing, scoring, checking, puck control and more. Both teams also have a deck of cards to use in various situations, typical cards like Slapshot, Deke, Great Pass, Interference and One-timer are included.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: D100 Dungeon: The Dragons Return Monster Cards
boardgame.description: The D100 Dungeon - The Dragons Return Monster Cards contains the 36 monster cards found on Table EB – Encounter B from The Dragons Return expansion book. The new monster cards can be used either as a reference to those monsters or in conjunction with the mapping game, by adding the new monsters cards to your existing monster deck, and whenever you draw an encounter token dimply choose which of the monster cards you will encounter with a matching number.

boardgame.name: D100 Dungeon: The Computer Companion
boardgame.description: D100 Dungeon - The Computer Companion, draws the maps and processes the adventure sheets, allowing you to sit back, relax and enjoy the story being created. Plus you will have professional looking maps to print out and keep for years to come. Created by Steve Weinrich from DungeonsoftwareUS and Aaron Boggs. With images, rules and design advice from Martin Knight.
